• yaspin
  • kbi_safe_yaspin
  • _kbi_safe_doc
   1 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
   2 
   3 """
   4 yaspin.api
   5 ~~~~~~~~~~
   6 
   7 This module implements the Yaspin API.
   8 
   9 :copyright: (c) 2018 by Pavlo Dmytrenko.
  10 :license: MIT, see LICENSE for more details.
  11 """
  12 
  13 import signal
  14 
  15 from .core import Yaspin
  16 from .signal_handlers import default_handler
  17 
  18 
  19 def yaspin(*args, **kwargs):
  20     """Display spinner in stdout.
  21 
  22     Can be used as a context manager or as a function decorator.
  23 
  24     Arguments:
  25         spinner (base_spinner.Spinner, optional): Spinner object to use.
  26         text (str, optional): Text to show along with spinner.
  27         color (str, optional): Spinner color.
  28         on_color (str, optional): Color highlight for the spinner.
  29         attrs (list, optional): Color attributes for the spinner.
  30         reversal (bool, optional): Reverse spin direction.
  31         side (str, optional): Place spinner to the right or left end
  32             of the text string.
  33         sigmap (dict, optional): Maps POSIX signals to their respective
  34             handlers.
  35 
  36     Returns:
  37         core.Yaspin: instance of the Yaspin class.
  38 
  39     Raises:
  40         ValueError: If unsupported ``color`` is specified.
  41         ValueError: If unsupported ``on_color`` is specified.
  42         ValueError: If unsupported color attribute in ``attrs``
  43             is specified.
  44         ValueError: If trying to register handler for SIGKILL signal.
  45         ValueError: If unsupported ``side`` is specified.
  46 
  47     Available text colors:
  48         red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white.
  49 
  50     Available text highlights:
  51         on_red, on_green, on_yellow, on_blue, on_magenta, on_cyan,
  52         on_white, on_grey.
  53 
  54     Available attributes:
  55         bold, dark, underline, blink, reverse, concealed.
  56 
  57     Example::
  58 
  59         # Use as a context manager
  60         with yaspin():
  61             some_operations()
  62 
  63         # Context manager with text
  64         with yaspin(text="Processing..."):
  65             some_operations()
  66 
  67         # Context manager with custom sequence
  68         with yaspin(Spinner('-\\|/', 150)):
  69             some_operations()
  70 
  71         # As decorator
  72         @yaspin(text="Loading...")
  73         def foo():
  74             time.sleep(5)
  75 
  76         foo()
  77 
  78     """
  79     return Yaspin(*args, **kwargs)
  80 
  81 
  82 def kbi_safe_yaspin(*args, **kwargs):
  83     kwargs["sigmap"] = {signal.SIGINT: default_handler}
  84     return Yaspin(*args, **kwargs)
  85 
  86 
  87 # Handle PYTHONOPTIMIZE=2 case, when docstrings are set to None.
  88 if yaspin.__doc__:
  89     _kbi_safe_doc = yaspin.__doc__.replace("yaspin", "kbi_safe_yaspin")
  90     kbi_safe_yaspin.__doc__ = _kbi_safe_doc
